materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 1 ball 2154 Zesty Stripes A
RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball 7275 Coral B
Susan Bates® Double End Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scrubby measures 3¾" wide x 5" long (9.5 x 12.5 cm).
gauge: 13 Tps = 3" (7.5 cm); 18 rows = 4" (10 cm) with A and Tunisian hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A and Tunisian hook, ch 17.
Row 1 (wrong side):
Forward Pass: Working in back bars, insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yarn over and pull up a loop, [insert hook in next ch, yarn over and pull up a loop] across; leave all loops on hook—17 loops. 
Return Pass: Working from left to right, yarn over and draw through first loop on hook, *yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across—1 loop on hook.
Row 2:
Forward Pass: Tps in each st across to last st, Tss in last st; leave all loops on hook.
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass. 
Rows 3–20: Repeat Row 2.
Row 21: 
Forward Pass: Repeat Row 2 Forward Pass.
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass until 2 loops remain on hook; drop A; with B, yarn over and draw through last 2 loops. Leaving a 2-yd (2m) tail, cut A. 
Row 22: 
Forward Pass: Tss2tog, Tss in next 11 sts, Tss2tog, Tss in last st—15 loops.
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass. 
Rows 23–38: 
Forward Pass: Tss in each st across. 
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass. 
Bind Off Row: Inserting hook as for Tss, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With wrong sides together, fold scrubby in half at Row 22 and hold with A-side facing. With standard hook, draw end tail through to underside of piece. 
Optional To minimize weaving in, tuck in ends between sides.
Joining Row: Working through both thicknesses of 3 sides and holding tail under piece throughout, insert hook in end of row nearest fold and pull up a loop, surface slip st in ends of rows of both edges and in sts across bottom edge, easing to fit as needed. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball 215 Bamboo or 805 Stream
measurements: Washcloth measures approximately 8” [20.5 cm] wide x 7” [18 cm] long
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
NOTE
All dc should be worked in space between dc of previous row.
SCRUBBY
Chain 28.
Row 1: Dc in third chain from hook and in each chain across – 25 dc. Skipped 2 stitches do not count as first dc.
Row 2: Chain 3 (does not count as a dc here and throughout), turn, work dc in space between each stitch – 25 dc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 7” [18 cm] from beginning.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball each 995 Ocean A and 932 Popsicle Brights C
1 ball each 805 Stream B and 620 Lime D
Susan Bates® Double End Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 4" (10 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 16 sts = 4" (10 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A & B and C & D)
With first color, ch 23.
Row 1 (wrong side):
Forward Pass: Working in back bars, insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yarn over and pull up a loop, *insert hook in next ch, yarn over and pull up a loop; repeat from * across; leave all loops on hook—23 loops.
Return Pass: Yarn over and draw through first loop on hook, *yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across to last 3 loops; change to 2nd color, Tdec in last 3 loops—1 loop.
Row 2: 
Forward Pass: Skip Tdec, Tks in each st across to last st, Tinc, inserting hook from front to back through 2 vertical strands, Tss in last st; leave all loops on hooks.
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass; change to first color.
Row 3: 
Forward Pass: Repeat Row 2 Forward Pass.
Return Pass: Yarn over and draw through first loop on hook, *yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * across to last 3 loops, Tdec in last 3 loops.
Row 4: 
Forward Pass: Repeat Row 2 Forward Pass.
Return Pass: Repeat Row 1 Return Pass. 
Rows 5–22: Repeat Rows 2–4 six times. 
Rows 23 and 24: Repeat Rows 2 and 3. 
Fasten off 2nd color, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Bind Off Row: With first color and right sides held together, working in opposite side of foundation ch, insert hook in back loop of first ch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over, draw through both loops on hook, *inserting hook as if to Tks in next st and in back loop of next foundation ch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook; repeat from * across. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
FINISHING
Turn scrubby right side out. Weave first color tail through ends of rows, pull tightly to gather. Knot securely and weave in end. Repeat with remaining tail.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 501 Ocean A, 241 Duckie B, and 620 Lime C
3 yds dark grey worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Mitt measures 6" wide x 7" long (15 x 18 cm), excluding tentacles.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Body (make 2) 
With A, ch 18. 
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—16 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each dc across, working last dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 12 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—18 dc.
Rows 4–10: Repeat Row 2.
Row 11: Ch 3, [dc2tog] 8 times, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—10 dc.
Row 12: Ch 3, [dc2tog] 4 times, dc in top of beginning ch—6 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Eye (make 2)
With B, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Tentacle (make 8) 
With C, ch 11.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in next ch, 2 hdc in next ch, 2 dc in next 4 ch, dc in next 2 ch, (dc, slip st) in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Finish sewing body pieces together, placing the eyes and embroidering the smile.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10: 20 yd each 322 Hot Pink A, 154 Parakeet B, 119 Violet C. Note: Each color will make one soap cover.
Tapestry needle, oval bars of soap.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cover will fit a regular-size bar of soap.
gauge: 9 sts = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COVER (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 6; taking care not to twist ch; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 7 (counts as tr, ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 3 times, [tr in ring, ch 3] twice, [dc in ring, ch 3] 3 times, tr in ring, ch 3; join with slip st in 5th ch of beginning ch-7—6 dc, 4 tr, and 10 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st into next ch-space, [ch 7, sc in next ch-space] 9 times, ch 3, dc in next ch-space (last ch-3, dc counts as a ch-space)—10 ch-spaces.
Round 3: [Ch 9, sc in next ch-space] 9 times, ch 4, tr in next ch-space (last ch-4, tr counts as a ch-space).
Rounds 4 and 5: [Ch 11, sc in next ch-space] 9 times, ch 5, dtr in next ch-space (last ch-5, dtr counts as a ch-space).
Round 6: Repeat Round 3.
Round 7: Repeat Round 2.
Fasten off.
HEART (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in 3rd ch from hook, turn—5 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—7 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in top of turning ch, turn—9 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, skip first dc, tr3tog over next 3 dc, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, tr3tog over next 3 dc, ch 3, slip st in top of turning ch. 
Fasten off.
TIE (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 150. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew heart to center front of mesh cover. Weave tie through spaces of last round of mesh cover. Insert soap into mesh cover and pull on ends of tie to tighten cover over soap. Tie ends into a knot or bow.

abbreviations: Bpdc: (back post double crochet) Yarn over, insert hook from back to front then to back, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st in front of the Bpdc.

Fpdc: (front post double crochet) Yarn over, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st behind the Fpdc.
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Mom’s Mitt is 9” [23 cm] tall and Child’s Mitt is 6” [15 cm] tall.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for RED HEART® Scrubby™, Art. E833 available in solids 3.5 oz (100 g), 92 yd (85 m), prints 3.0 oz (85 g) 78 yds (71 m) balls.
instructions:
MOM’S MITT
Ch 30.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across – 28 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, [Fpdc, Bpdc] across to last st, dc in last st. 
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 7½” [19 cm] from beginning.
Decrease Row: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 14 times – 14 sc.
Repeat Decrease Row – 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Thread tail through remaining sts and pull to close. Secure end.
FINISHING
Embroider eyes in satin stitch with Black.
EAR (make 2) 
Ch 10.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 5 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next 6 ch – 20 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to end of row. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Fold straight short end in half and sew Ear on one side of top of Mitt. Repeat to sew opposite Ear on opposite side at top of Mitt.
TAIL
Wrap yarn around square of cardboard 40 times. Slide off cardboard and tie a piece of yarn tightly around center of loops. Cut all loops open and trim to desired length. Sew Tail in center of back of Mitt. 
Weave in ends. 
CHILD’S MITT
Ch 26.
Work as for Mom’s Mitt until piece measures 4½” [11.5 cm] from beginning – 24 sts. 
Decrease Row: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 12 times – 12 sc.
Repeat Decrease Row – 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Thread tail through remaining sts and pull to close. Secure end.
Work Ears and Tail and Finishing as for Mom’s Mitt.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 1 Ball 1740 Rose OR 1645 Moss A, 1 Ball 1105 Vanilla B for each Mitt.
abbreviations: sc2tog (sc dec) = Insert hook into st and draw up a loop.
Insert hook into next st and draw up a loop. Yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc2tog (dc dec) = [Yarn over, insert hook into next st and draw up a loop, yarn over and pull through 2 loops] twice. Yarn over, draw through all loops on hook.
A, B, etc = color A, B, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: One size.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4” in pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MITT
With A, ch 40. Slip st in first ch to form a loop.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, change to B in last st, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 40 sts.
Round 2: With B, ch 1, sc in each dc around, change to A in last st, slip st to first sc to join.
Repeat Rounds 1 and 2 twice more, then Round 1 once more.
Shape Hand
Round 8: With B, ch 1, work 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 18 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 18 sts, 2 sc in last st, slip st in beginning ch – 44 sts.
Round 9: With A, repeat Round 1.
Round 10: With B, ch 1, sc in first 21 sts, [2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in last 21 sts, slip st in first sc – 46 sts.
Round 11: With A, ch 3, dc in first 20 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 21 sts, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 sts.
Round 12: With B, ch 1, sc in first 21 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 21 sts, slip st in first sc – 50 sts.
Round 13: With A, ch 3, dc in first 20 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 21 sts, slip st in top of beginning ch – 52 sts.
Round 14: With B, ch 1, sc in 21 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 21 sts, slip st in first sc – 54 sts.
Round 15: With A, ch 3, dc in 20 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 10 sts, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 21 sts, slip st in top of beginning ch – 56 sts.
Round 16: With B, ch 1, sc in first 21 sts, 2 sc in next st, skip next 12 sts for Thumb, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 21 sts, slip st in first sc – 46 sts.
Round 17: With A, repeat Round 1 – 46 sts.
Round 18: With B, repeat Round 2.
Repeat Rounds 1-2 on 46 sts until piece measures 7” from beginning, end with Round 1.
Shape Tip
Round 1: With B, ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sts, sc2tog, slip st in first sc – 42 sts.
Round 2: With A, ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next 15 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 2 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 16 sts, dc2tog, slip st in top of beginning ch – 38 sts.
Round 3: With B, ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 14 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 14 sts, sc2tog, slip st in first sc – 34 sts.
Round 4: With A, ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next 11 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 2 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 12 sts, dc2tog, slip st in top of beginning ch – 30 sts.
Round 5: With B, ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sts, sc2tog, slip st in first sc – 26 sts.
Round 6: With A, ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next 7 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 2 sts, dc2tog, dc in next 8 sts, dc2tog, slip st in top of beginning ch – 22 sts.
Round 7: With B, ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog, slip st in first sc – 18 sts.
Round 8: With A, ch 3, [dc2tog] 9 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Thumb
Keeping in pattern st, join B in first st of skipped Thumb sts on Round 16, ch 1, sc in each skipped sc, work 2 sc in next st on Hand, slip st in first sc to join – 14 sts.
Working in pattern st, alternating colors every round, work 5 rounds.
Last Round: With B, ch 1, [sc2tog] around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Thread tails at tip of Hand through remaining sts and pull to close. Knot to secure. Repeat to close tip of Thumb.
Weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”, Art. E749 available in 3 oz (85 g), 145 yd (132 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie®: 1 ball 9205 Aqua
abbreviations: Bpsc: (back post single crochet) Insert hook from back to front then to back, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Skip st in front of Bpsc.
Fpsc: (front post single crochet) Insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Skip st behind Fpsc.

reverse sc (reverse single crochet) = Work single crochet in opposite direction from which you would usually work (left to right if you are right-handed and right to left if you are left-handed). This st is also known as crab st. It creates a rope-like twisted single crochet edging.
measurements: Washcloth measures 7" [18 cm] x 7" [18 cm].
gauge: 13 dc = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WASHCLOTH
Ch 26.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch count as dc) dc in each ch across – 24 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, *Bpsc, Fpsc; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st. 
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each st across. 
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, *Fpsc, Bpsc; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st. 
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until piece measures 7" [18 cm] from beginning, ending with Row 2 or 4.
Edging
Ch 1. turn to work along outside edges, work reverse sc evenly spaced around, working (sc, ch 1, sc) in each corner, slip st in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Abbreviations
ch = chain; cm = centimeters; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7275 Coral A, 7683 Denim B, 7105 Loofa C
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scrubby measures 7" [18 cm] x 7" [18 cm].
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
NOTES
When changing colors, work last step of last st of previous color with new color. Carry colors not in use loosely along side of work. Work Edging over carried strands along sides to hide.
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
Fptr: (front post treble crochet) [Yarn over] twice, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times. Skip st behind the Fptr.
WASHCLOTH
With A, ch 17.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch and in each across – 15 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 15 sc.
Row 3: With B, ch 3 (does not count as a st here and throughout), turn, [dc in next st, Fptr in dc in row below next sc] across to last st, dc in last st.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 5: With C, ch 3, turn, [dc in next st, Fptr in next Fptr] to last st, dc in last st.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 7-8: With A, repeat Rows 5-6.
Row 9-10: With B, repeat Rows 5-6.
Repeat Rows 5-8 once more, drawing up C in last st. Cut A and B.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and C, ch 1, sc 14 evenly spaced along each side edge, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner, slip st in first sc to join – 64 sc and 4 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join B in any ch-2 corner space, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in same ch-2 space, sc in each sc around working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each ch-2 space, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
With A, repeat Round 2.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™, Art. E833 available 3.5 oz (100 g), 92 yd (85 m) balls
1 ball of 241 Duckie A and 10 Coconut B
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * or as indicated.
measurements: Daisy measures 8” (20.5 cm) in diameter
gauge: 3 dc = 1”. GAUGE is not critical for this project.
instructions:
DAISY 
With A, ch 4.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4 – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first st, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 36 dc.
Round 4: Slip st around the post of beginning ch-3 in preceding round, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc in same round, turn, work 10 sc over ch-7 loop, turn, skip loop just made, slip st around the post of next dc*; repeat from * to * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 18 ch-7 loops.
Round 5: Repeat Round 4 in sts of Round 2 – 12 loops.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4 in sts of Round 1 – 6 loops. Fasten off.
Border: With right side facing, working behind Round, join B with a slip st to any dc in Round 3.
Round 1: Ch 3, 2 dc in first st, 3 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 108 dc.
Round 2: *Skip next 2 dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around – 18 shells. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 620 Lime A and 940 Capri B OR 1 ball each 501 Ocean A and 620 Lime B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
measurements: Scrubby measures about 5½” [14 cm] across hand and 6½” [16.5 cm] high, not including hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: HAND Beginning at wrist, with A, ch 12 Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—11 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st—13 sc. Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st—14 sc. Row 7: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each remaining st across—15 sc. Rows 8 and 9: Repeat Rows 6 and 7—17 sc. Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Shape Thumb Row 11 (right side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first 4 sts, sc2tog; leave last 11 sts unworked for fingers—5 sc. Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts—4 sc. Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog; work 3 slip sts evenly spaced down side edge of thumb to just before first unworked st of Row 10. Do not fasten off. Continue Hand Row 11 Continued (right side): Sc in first unworked st of Row 10 and in each unworked st of Row 10 across—11 sc. Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Index Finger Row 13 (right side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 sts; leave last 8 sts unworked for remaining 3 fingers—3 sc. Rows 14–16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off. Middle Finger Row 13 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first unworked st of Row 12 following index finger, sc in next 2 sts; leave last 5 sts unworked for remaining 2 fingers—3 sc. Rows 14–18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off. Ring Finger Row 13 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first unworked st of Row 12 following middle finger, sc in next 2 sts; leave last 2 sts unworked for pinky—3 sc. Rows 14–17: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc3tog—1 sc. Fasten off. Pinky Row 13 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first unworked st of Row 12 following ring finger, sc in next st—2 sc. Rows 14 and 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off. EDGING AND HANGING LOOP With right side facing, join B with sc in lower corner below pinky, sc evenly spaced all the way around working 2 sc at the tip of each finger and thumb, 2 sc at each lower corner, and 1 slip st between fingers; join with slip st in first sc, ch 12 (for hanging loop), slip st in same sc again. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pocket measures 3” wide x 5” long (7.5 x 12.5 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
POCKET
Ch 8.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 5 ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same st as join, *skip next sc, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * 6 times, skip last sc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Rounds 3–7: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, 2 dc in same dc, *skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, skip last dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—eight 3-dc groups.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc same st as join, sc in next 13 dc, (sc, ch 10, slip st) in next dc, sc in each remaining dc; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 1 ch-10 button loop.
FINISHING
Flatten pocket so button loop is centered at back of piece. Sew button to center of front below top edge. Weave in ends. Insert soap in pocket and fasten button loop over button.

abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 5½" (14 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 4 rows = 2½" (6.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Baseball (make 2)
Ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing on 1 piece.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, embroider ball stitching with red yarn and chain stitches. With wrong sides held together and red sts matching, sew pieces together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8931 Pink Grapefruit or 8260 Orange A and 8930 Watermelon or 8215 Lemon 8931 B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B
measurements: Scrubby measures 5" (12.5 cm) across.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc. Fasten off.
Round 2: Working in spaces between sts, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first space, 2 dc in each space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in same st as join, 3 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top—72 dc.
Round 4: Repeat Round 3—216 dc. Fasten off.
Round 5: Join B with slip st in any dc, ch 3, 2 dc in same st as join, 3 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top—648 dc. Fasten off.
Strap
With A and leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 16.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—13 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew short edges of strap to opposite edges of Round 4. Sew again over stitches just made to reinforce.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7105 Loofa A and 7365 Tan B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures about 8½" [21.5 cm] wide and 8¾" [22 cm] long.
gauge: 7 triangle stitches = 4" [10 cm] measured across widest part (bottom) of stitch; 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 2)
Note: Make one scrubby using A as first color and B as 2nd color. Make second scrubby using B as first color and A as 2nd color.
With first color, ch 26.
Row 1 (wrong side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped ch count as first hdc), hdc in each remaining ch across, turn—25 hdc.
Row 2: Beg hdc, ch 1, first triangle stitch, *ch 1, next triangle stitch; repeat from * to beginning ch, ch 1, hdc in in top of beginning ch, turn—2 hdc, 11 triangle sts, and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, hdc in each st and ch-1 space across, turn—25 hdc.
Row 4: Beg hdc, ch 1, first triangle stitch, *ch 1, next triangle stitch; repeat from * to last hdc, ch 1, hdc in last hdc, turn.
Rows 5-16: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 six times.
Fasten off.
Border Round: With right side facing, join 2nd color with slip st in first ch-1 space of Row 16, [sm shell in next ch-1 space, slip st in next ch-1 space] 5 times, skip last ch-1 space; working in ends of rows of side edge, lg shell in first row, [skip next row, slip st in next row, skip next row, sm shell in next row] 3 times, skip next row, slip st in next row, skip last row; working along opposite side of foundation ch, lg shell in first ch, [skip next ch, slip st in next ch, skip next ch, sm shell in next ch] 5 times, skip next ch, slip st in next ch, skip last 2 ch; working in ends of rows of side edge, lg shell in first row, slip st in next row, [skip next row, sm shell in next row, skip next row, slip st in next row] 3 times, skip next row, lg shell in last row; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 0561 Grape A, 0709 Bubblegum B, 0010 Coconut C, 0241 Duckie D
1 yd (1 m) black worsted weight yarn (to embroider eyes)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 6¼” (16 cm) diameter across shell.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Bottom of Shell
With D, work Rounds 1–5 same as top of shell, do not change colors. 
Opening for Hand
Round 1: With wrong sides of shells held together and working through both thicknesses, join B with sc in any hdc, sc in next 35 sts; working through top of shell only, sc in remaining 12 sts; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Note: For head, legs, and tail, place marker for beginning of round at end of Round 1 and move marker up as each round is completed.
Head 
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3–7: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 7. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Leg (make 4) 
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc. 
Round 2: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice—9 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 5. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
SCRUBBY
Top of Shell
With A, ch 4.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc); change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each dc around; change to C; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; change to A; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in dc around. Fasten off.
Tail
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—6 sc. 
Rounds 2–4: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 4. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Use photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces. 
Head 
Holding shell with opening at bottom, center and sew head to closed edge of shell directly opposite opening for hand. With black yarn, embroider 2 French knots for eyes.
Legs 
Sew legs evenly spaced apart on underside of shell. 
Tail 
Center and sew tail at opening for hand on wrong side of top shell.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7503 Lavender A and 7501 Caribbean B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 7" [18 cm] x 7" [18 cm].
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
WASHCLOTH
With A, ch 19.
Row 1: Cluster in 3rd ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, Cluster in next ch] across – 9 Clusters and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, [Cluster in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 8 times, Cluster in top of beginning ch-2 – 9 Clusters and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 5½" [14 cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
Scallop Edging
Round 1: Join B in any corner with a slip st, ch 1, sc in same space as join, ch 2, sc in same space (first corner formed), sc 13 sts evenly spaced along each side edge, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner, slip st in first sc to join – 60 sc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st to ch-2 space, ch 2 (counts as hdc), 4 hdc in same ch-2 space, *[skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, 5 hdc in next sc] 3 times, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc**, 5 hdc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 more times, ending last repeat at **, slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend” – Solid Color Projects: 2 Balls of 1645 Moss or 1370 Candy Marl.
RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend” – Reversible Projects: 2 Balls 1645 Moss A, 1 ball each 1370 Candy Marl B and 1105 Vanilla C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Washcloth measures 8” x 8”; Exfoliator/Scrubber measures 3 1/4” across; Soap Bag measures 4” x 4”; Towel measures 10 1/2” x 18”.
gauge: Rnd 1-3 = 3 1/4” across; 15 dc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WASHCLOTH
Solid Color Version: 
Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, 15 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 16 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each dc around; join – 32 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in each dc around; join with a slip st in first sc – 32 sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same sc as joining, * ch 1, skip next 3 sc, 3 dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next 3 sc **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 5: Slip st in next 2 dc and into ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, * ch 1, [3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1] twice **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 6: Slip st in next 2 dc and into ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, * ch 1, [3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 3 times **, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Rnd 7: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 5 dc in ch-3 space, dc in each dc and ch-1 space around working 5 dc in each ch-3 corner; join – 96 sts (19 sts each side, 5 sts each corner).
Rnd 8: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in next 4 sts, 3 sc in next st, [sc in next 23 sts, 3 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in last 18 sts; join.
Rnd 9: Ch 3, dc in next 5 sc, 3 dc in next sc, [dc in next 25 sc, 3 dc in next sc] 3 times, dc in last 19 sc; join – 112 sts (25 each side, 3 each corner). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Reversible Version: 
With A, ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1 (Side A): Ch 3, 15 dc in ring; join with a sl st to top of ch-3 – 16 sts. Fasten off A.
Rnd 2A: Working in front loop only, join B in front loop of any st, ch 3, dc in same loop, 2 dc in each front loop around; join – 32 sts. Fasten off B. TURN piece to other side.
Rnd 2 (Side B): Working in remaining front loops, join C in any loop; ch 3, dc in same loop, 2 dc in each loop around; join — 32 sts. Fasten off C.
Rnd 3B: Working through all loops of both sides, join A in any st, ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around; join – 32 sc.
Rnds 4-6: With A, repeat Rnds 4-6 of solid version. Fasten off A.

SPA NECESSITIES SET | CROCHET
Tie (Make 2): 
Ch 81. Fasten off. Weave through spaces at top of bag, beginning at side; tie ends in a knot and trim. Weave the 2nd tie through same spaces from opposite side. 

TOWEL
Squares (Make 3): 
Work Rnds 1-4 of washcloth, joining on 1 side to make a strip of 3.
Row 1 (Right Side): With right side facing, join in corner ch-3 space; ch 3, work 41 dc across; turn – 41 dc.
Rows 2-32: Ch 2 (do not count this as a stitch), dc in each dc across; turn – 41 dc.
Row 33: Ch 1, sc in each dc across. Fasten off.
Edging: With right side facing, join yarn in ch-3 corner of square right below where towel begins; ch 1, sc in each st and space around squares only. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

EXFOLIATOR/SCRUBBER
Work Rnds 1-3 of Washcloth. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

SOAP BAG (Make 2 squares):
Square 1
Rnds 1-4: Work Rnds 1-4 of washcloth. Fasten off.
Square 2
Rnd 1-3: Work Rnds 1-3 of washcloth.
Rnd 4 (Joining Rnd): Ch 3, 2 dc in same sc, * ch 1, sc in

materials: RED HEART® Eco-Cotton Blend™: 3 balls 1645 Moss
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Washcloth measures 8½” x 8½”; Towel measures 14” x 20”; Soap Holder measures 3½” x 5”
gauge: GAUGES: Rnds 1-3 = 3½” across. 16 dc = 4”
instructions:
WASHCLOTH
Ch 4; join with a sl st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 3 dc in ring, [ch 2, 4 dc in ring] 3 times, ch 2; 
join with a sl st in top of ch-3.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in ch-2 
sp, dc in next 4 dc] 3 times, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in last 
ch-2 sp; join in top of ch-3.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in ch-2 
sp, dc in next 8 dc] 3 times, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in last 
ch-2 sp, dc in next 2 dc; join.
Rnds 4-7: Ch 3, [dc in each dc to corner, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) 
all in ch-2 sp] 4 times, dc in each dc to end; join.
Edging Rnd 8: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * ch 1, skip 
next dc or ch, sc in next dc or ch; rep from * around; join 
with a sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
TOWEL
Make 8 squares same as Washcloth through Rnd 3. 
Fasten off. Sew 4 squares together in a strip for bottom 
edge. Sew 4 squares together in a strip for top edge. 
Center of Towel-Row 1: With right side facing, beginning 
at top right-hand edge of a strip, attach yarn in corner 
ch-2 sp; ch 3, work 13 dc across first square, [work 14 dc 
across next square] 3 times; turn – 56 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in next dc and each dc 
across, dc in top of ch-3; turn.
Rep Row 2 until center measures 13” (16½” from 
beginning). Fasten off leaving a long tail. Sew strip for top 
edge to last row of dc.
Edging: With right side facing, attach yarn in any st; ch 1, 
sc in same st as joining, * ch 1, skip next dc or ch, sc in 
next dc or ch; rep from * around all 4 sides; join with a sl st 
in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
SOAP HOLDER
Make 2 squares same as Washcloth through Rnd 3. 
Fasten off.
Gusset: With right side facing, attach yarn in a ch-2 sp, ch 
3, work 13 dc across to next corner, [work 14 dc across to 
next corner] twice. Fasten off.
Sew 2nd square to gusset, sewing 14 sts of gusset to each 
of three sides of square.
Top Edge-Rnd 1: With right side facing, attach yarn at 
corner of square; ch 3, work 13 more dc across square, 
work 3 dc across gusset, 14 dc across next square, 3 dc 
across gusset; join with a sl st in top of ch-3; turn.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join; turn.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * ch 1, skip next dc, 
sc in next dc; rep from * around; join with a sl st in first sc. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 10 Coconut A, 510 Glacier B, 215 Bamboo C, and 805 Stream D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 4" (10 cm) in diameter, gathered.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 3—1 each with A & B, A & C, and A & D)
With A, ch 5.
Round 1: Work 8 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—9 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in space between first 2 sts, 2 dc in each remaining space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—18 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, *dc in next space, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—27 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, *dc in next 2 spaces, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, *dc in next 3 spaces, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—45 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, *dc in next 4 spaces, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—54 dc.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in each space around; change to 2nd color; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each space around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Thread tail onto yarn needle. Working along Round 8, insert needle into every 9th st and beginning st; pull tight. Insert needle into Round 1 to secure. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 620 Lime A, 241 Duckie B, and 258 Orange C
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 yd of 312 Black D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 7” (18 cm) long, excluding hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A and B)
Beginning at top of head, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 5: Repeat Row 2—11 sc.
Rows 6–10: Repeat Row 4.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc3tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc3tog, turn—7 sc.
Row 12: Ch 12, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in first 6 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—19 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc, turn—20 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—21 sc.
Row 15: Repeat Row 13—22 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc, turn —21 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—20 sc.
Rows 18 and 19: Repeat Rows 16 and 17—18 sc.
Rows 20 and 21: Repeat Row 16—16 sc.
Row 22: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 23 and 24: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.
Round 25: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog; *working in ends of rows and adding sc as needed to keep piece flat, sc in each row* to Row 12; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each remaining ch, repeat from * to * to Row 1; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 2 sc in first ch, sc in next ch, (sc, ch 9, slip st) in next sc (hanging loop made), sc in next ch, 2 sc in last ch; repeat from * to * around to first sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Beak (make 2) 
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in last sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2. Leaving a long tail for sewing, fasten off.
FINISHING
With ending tail, sew beak to head. With D, embroider satin stitches for each eye. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7105 Loofa A, 7683 Denim B, and 7275 Coral C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Washcloth measures 6½" [16.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 5, slip stitch in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, ch 1, [3 dc into ring, ch 1] 4 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 15 dc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in second dc of 3-dc group, [skip next dc, (2 dc, tr, ch 1, tr, 2 dc) all in next ch-1 space, skip next dc, slip st in second dc of next 3-dc group] 4 times, (2 dc, tr, ch 1, tr, dc) all in next ch-1 space, slip st in first slip st –20 dc, 10 tr, and 5 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B in any ch-1 space with a slip st, ch 1, [2 sc in ch-1 space, sc in next 3 sts, skip slip st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times, slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st, [sc in next 2 sc, dc in next sc, tr in next 2 sc, dc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times, slip st in first sc – 10 tr, 10 dc and 20 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 9 times, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in first sc – 50 sc. Fasten off.
Round 6: Join C in any sc with a slip st, ch 1, 2 sc in same st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 9 times, sc in next 4 sts, slip st in first sc – 60 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] 9 times, sc in next 5 sts, slip st in first sc – 70 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, [sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 9 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in first sc – 80 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 2 balls of 10 Coconut
measurements: Back Scrubber measures 5½ x 22” (14 x 56 cm), not including handles.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet (dc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BACK SCRUBBER
Ch 22.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc) and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 dc.
Rows 2–48: Ch 3 (counts as dc), Fpdc around next 18 dc, dc in top of turning ch, turn.
First Handle: Ch 35, skip first 19 sts of Row 48, slip st in last st, turn, sc in each ch across, slip st in beginning of Row 48. Fasten off.
Second Handle: Join yarn with slip st in corner of short end of scratcher that does not yet have a handle, ch 35, slip st in other corner of short end of scratcher, turn, sc in each ch across, slip st near joining slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball 951 Jadetones A COATS® Crème de la Crème®
1 ball 7586 Jade B RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™
Susan Bates® Double End Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 6½" x 6½" (16.5 x 16.5 cm)
gauge: 15 sts = 4" (10 cm); 20 rows = 4" (10 cm) with double end hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A and double end hook, ch 25.
Row 1: Working in back bars, insert hook in 2nd ch from hook, yarn over and pull up a loop, *insert hook in next ch, yarn over and pull up a loop; repeat from * across; leave all loops on hook—25 loops on hook. Slide sts to opposite end of hook and turn.
Row 2: Place B on hook with slip knot and draw through first loop, *yarn over, draw through 2 loops; repeat from * across—1 loop on hook. Do not slide sts or turn hook.
Row 3: With B, ch 1, *yarn over, skip next horizontal st, insert hook in next horizontal st and pull up a loop; repeat from * across; leave all loops on hook. Slide all sts to opposite end of hook and turn.
Row 4: With A, yarn over, draw through first loop on hook, *yarn over, draw through 2 loops; repeat from * across—1 loop on hook. Do not slide sts or turn hook.
Row 5: With A, ch 1, *insert hook in next horizontal st, pull up a loop; repeat from * across. Slide sts to opposite end of hook and turn.
Row 6: With B, yarn over, draw through first loop on hook, *yarn over, draw through 2 loops; repeat from * across. Do not slide sts or turn hook.
Rows 7–30: Repeat Rows 3–6 six times.
Rows 31 and 32: Repeat Rows 3 and 4.
Bind Off Row: With A, ch 1, slip st in each horizontal st across—1 loop on hook. Fasten off B.
Edging
Place A-colored loop on standard hook.
First Side Edging: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced down side edge; join with slip st in first foundation ch. Fasten off.
2nd Side Edging: With right side of bottom edge facing, join A with slip st in last foundation ch, ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced up side edge; join with slip st in end of Row 33. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8417 Oyster A, 8215 Lemon B, 8570 Grape C, 8690 Avocado D, and 8260 Orange E
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scubby measures 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
ROCKET FRONT
Beginning at top point, with A, ch 2. 
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc – 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each st to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 7 sc. 
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Rows 5-6: Repeat Row 3, changing to C in last sc of Row 6 – 11 sc on last row worked.
Row 7: With C, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 8: Repeat Row 3, changing to A in last sc – 13 sc.
Row 9: With A, repeat Row 3 – 15 sc, changing to C in last st.
Rows 10-11: With C, repeat Row 3, changing to A in last st of Row 11 – 19 sc on last row worked.
Rows 12-27: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc – 17 sc.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Rows 30-31: Repeat Rows 28-29 – 15 sc. 
Row 31: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, *Fpdc around post of next sc, Bpdc around post of next sc; repeat from * across to last st, dc in last st. 
Row 32: Ch 3, turn, *Bpdc around post of next dc, Fpdc around post of next dc; repeat from * across to last st, dc in last st.
Fasten off.

ROCKET BACK
With A only, work as for Rocket Front.

BACK FLAME
With E, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch sc in next 5 ch – 13 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, dc in next sc, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next sc, dc next sc, hdc in next 3 sc, sc in last 2 sc – 16 sts and one ch-1 space. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 8 sts, 3 sc in ch-1 space, sc in last 8 sts. Fasten off.

FRONT FLAME
With B, ch 7.
Row 1: Repeat Row 1 of Back Flame – 13 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, (hdc, dc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, dc, hdc) all in next st, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in next 2 sts. Fasten off. 

LARGE WINDOW
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in each sc across – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, changing to D in last st – 18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 

SMALL WINDOW
Work Rounds 1-2 as for Large Window. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 

WING (make 2)
With D, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, hdc next in next 4 sc, dc in next 3 sc – 11 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in next 3 sts, skip last sc – 10 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc next 2 sts, hdc next 4 sts, dc next 2 sts, 3 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Following photo, sew Large and Small Windows on Rocket Front.
Sew Front Flame in center of Back Flame. Sew in flat edge of Flame in center of bottom edge of Rocket Front. Sew Rocket Front and Back pieces together, leaving lower edge unsewn for inserting hand. Sew a Wing on either side of Rocket. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds /109 m)
Sage Green (00084) or Robin’s Egg (01215) or Hot Pink (01740) or Tangerine (01699) or Ecru (00004)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch.
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter.
gauge: 15 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same st as 
last sl st. 2 hdc in each dc around. 
Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and 
ch 1). *Popcorn in next hdc. Ch 1. 
1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Rep from * to 
last hdc. Popcorn in next hdc. Ch 1. 
Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7230 Peachy A and 7275 Coral B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Wash Cloth measures 7½" [19 cm] wide x 6" [15 cm] long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
WASH CLOTH
With A, chain 24.
Row 1: Hdc in third chain from hook and in each chain across – 22 half double crochets.
Rows 2-5: Chain 2, turn, hdc in each stitch across. At end of Row 5, change to B. Cut A.
Rows 6-9: With B, chain 2, turn, hdc in each stitch across. At end of Row 9, change to A. Cut B.
Rows 10-14: With A, chain 2, turn, hdc in each stitch across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 936 Waves A and 934 Candy B
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 316 Soft White C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pouf measures 6” (15 cm) in diameter.
gauge: is not important for this project.
instructions:
POUF (make 1 each with A and B)
Ch 103.
Foundation Row: Tr in 5th ch from hook (beginning 4 ch count as first tr) and in each ch across, turn—100 tr.
Row 1: Ch 4, tr in each tr across; working in end of Foundation Row, sl st in each ch.
Round 2: Working in opposite side of Foundation Row and in spaces between sts, ch 3, skip space between beginning ch and next tr, sc in next space, *ch 3, skip next 3 spaces, sc in next space; repeat from * across, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—25 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
With C, ch 80. Fasten off. Weave one tail through each ch-3 space. Pull tails to even lengths and tie a knot very tightly to shape and close pouf. To make a hanging loop, tie tails together in an over hand knot close to ends and trim close to knot.
